## {auto-animate=true}
<h2 data-id="title">Modern Generic Type Syntax</h2>

```{python}
#| code-line-numbers: "1-3|6-7"
# BEFORE
from typing import List, Dict
def f(xs: List[int]) -> Dict[str, int]: ...


# NOW: From Python 3.9
def f(xs: list[int]) -> dict[str, int]: ...
```

## {auto-animate=true}
<h2 data-id="title">PEP 604 Union Syntax</h2>

```{python}
#| code-line-numbers: "1-4|7-9"
#  OLD WAY
from typing import Union, Optional
x: Union[int, str]
y: Optional[int]


#  NEW WAY: From Python 3.9
x: int | str
y: int | None
```

## {auto-animate=true}
<h2 data-id="title">Modern type parameter syntax
</h2>

```{python}
#| code-line-numbers: "1-4|7-9"
#  OLD WAY
from typing import TypeVar
T = TypeVar("T")
def first(xs: list[T]) -> T: ...


#  NEW WAY: From Python 3.12
def first[T](xs: list[T]) -> T: ...
```

## {auto-animate=true}
<h2 data-id="title">Type Alias Statements
</h2>

```{python}
#| code-line-numbers: "1-3|6-8"
#  OLD WAY
from typing import TypeAlias
UserId: TypeAlias = int


#  NEW WAY: From Python 3.12
type UserId = int
type Box[T] = dict[str, T]
```

## {auto-animate=true}
<h2 data-id="title">Simplified Forward References
</h2>

```{python}
#| code-line-numbers: "1-4|5-8|10-13"
#  OLD WAY (Pre-Python 3.7)
class User:
    def manager(self) -> "User": ...

#  OLD WAY: (Python 3.7 - 3.10)
from __future__ import annotations
class User:
    def manager(self) -> User: ...

# MODERN BEHAVIOR (Python 3.14+ PEP 649)
# Annotations are lazily evaluated by default
class User:
    def manager(self) -> User: ...
```
